metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the Jingyangling station eddy covariance system (EC) in the upperstream reaches of the Heihe integrated observatory network from August 28 to December 31 in 2018. The site (101.1160E, 37.8384N) was located in the Jingyangling, near Qilian County in Qinghai Province. The elevation is 3750 m. The EC was installed at a height of 4.5 m, and the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3&Li7500) was 0.15 m.
The raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Eddypro post-processing software, including the spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. The observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC): class 1-3 (high quality), class 4-6 (good), class 7-8 (poor, better than gap filling data), class9 (rejected). In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data collected before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 10% of the 30 min raw record. There were 48 records per day, and the missing data were replaced with -6999. Suspicious data were marked in red. Data during insufficient power supply, data were missing occasionally.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xls format. Detailed information can be found in the suggested references.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.

该数据集包含了2018年8月28日至2018年12月31日的黑河流域地表过程综合观测网上游景阳岭站涡动相关仪观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县景阳岭垭口，下垫面是高寒草甸。观测点的经纬度是101.1160E, 37.8384N，海拔3750m。涡动相关仪的架高4.5m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速温度仪（CSAT3）与CO2/H2O分析仪（Li7500）之间的距离是15cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Eddypro软件处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Eddypro软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据中每30min内缺失率大于10%的数据。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。冬季由于供电不足，观测数据会有一些缺失。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），奥布霍夫长度L（m），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为九级（质量标识1-3数据质量好，4-6数据质量较好，7-8数据质量较差（较插补数据好）；9数据质量差））。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
黑河流域地表过程综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波 Bowen 比率-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈平流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这通常对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强平流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误造成的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括离地5米处的气温、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及在离地4.5米处使用10 Hz采样频率的涡度系统测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率。这是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years.

The associated open-access datasets include high-quality hydrometeorological data with specific respect to snow and frozen ground observations at the sub-basin and basin scales, which aims to address a variety of scientific questions including but not limited to: (1) how to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, (2) how to integrate observation, simulation and the acquired datasets for informative understanding, and (3) how perturbations (climate change and human activities) alter fundamental processes.

methods: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years. Composed of seven standard hydrometeorological stations, one snow superstation and one frozen ground superstation, the observation network serves as an integrated research platform aiming to provide prominent datasets (e.g., hydrometeorology, snow, and frozen ground) of the hydrometeorological processes in the upper reaches of the HRB, which is expected to support alpine region hydrological model development and simulations along with remote sensing observation.

In this paper, a suite of alpine hydrology datasets observed from an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) is presented.
backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的来源，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近年来气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，因此需要下一代观测和建模方法，以推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于高山地区观测数据的稀缺，主要是由于获取困难和技术障碍，阻碍了高山水文建模及相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在高山地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些都需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进高山地区水文研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在高山水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要的指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是高山地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活跃层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，进而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进高山水文研究，国际高山研究流域水文学网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领高山地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活跃层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活跃层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱黑河流域生态水文过程的主要组成部分，高山水文过程，特别是上游地区与雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，从而调节中游地区的农业发展和下游地区的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖分布广泛，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也很常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪盖的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂雪）现象。估计吹雪的发生非常重要，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。

相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是针对子流域和流域尺度的雪和冻土观测，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：（1）如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，（2）如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有益的理解，以及（3）扰动（气候变化和人类活动）如何改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔以及复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游地区运营的两个气象站正常工作）；2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并没有顺利进行。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无缝的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，配备了七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。在IOP之后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。雅口雪超级站自动测量积累和消耗过程，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和吹雪（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次中进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区的三个AMS中通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在A’rou冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在18个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深是通过SR50A（美国Campbell）测量的，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）是通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量的。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。

background: Accurate monitoring of surface fluxes over land surfaces is necessary for global climate change research, ecological environment management, and agricultural and water resource planning. The magnitude of the surface flux is largely determined by vegetation parameters, soil moisture and other states of the land surface. The major methods used for estimating surface fluxes are field measurement, remote-sensing-based methods, and land surface modeling. The variability in field measurements of surface flux has been documented over diurnal, seasonal, and inter-annual time scales.

Land surface models have been rapidly developed to predict surface fluxes on continuous spatial and temporal scales with physical constraints. Regardless of their specific model structures, all land surface models require observational data to calibrate their parameters and adjust their states. New techniques such as data assimilation are needed to integrate either field or remotely sensed observations with the models, thus improving model accuracy by correcting the model state variables and parameters. Data assimilation has played an increasingly important role in improving predictions of such land surface state variables as the leaf area index, soil temperature profile, soil moisture profile, and other related variables, e.g., surface fluxes.

Spatially distributed estimates of surface flux can be obtained from remote-sensing-based methods. The surface fluxes also can be obtained based on variational techniques and relatively simple models with the assimilation of field-measured land surface temperatures. In a land surface model, the sensible and latent heat fluxes are diagnostic variables, and they are affected by many factors (e.g., model states and parameters). As a new-generation Chinese polar orbiting meteorological satellite, the FY-3 series consists of two experimental (FY-3A/B) and at least four operational satellites (FY-3C/D/E/F). The FY-3 series is expected to have a service life that lasts until 2020. The FY-3A was launched in the year 2008. Visible and infrared radiometer (VIRR) is one of the 11 sensors mounted on the FY-3A satellite and has a nominal spatial resolution of approximately 1 km×1 km at the nadir. The common land model (CoLM) is a state-of-the-art model developed by many groups and validated with extensive field data sites. In CoLM, soil moisture is important for dividing the net radiation into the ground heat, sensible, and latent heat fluxes.

Inaccurate surface flux predictions are highly correlated with errors in land surface temperature estimates. Generally, the diurnal variation trends of the land surface temperature and surface flux can be predicted correctly using the CoLM. The daily averaged evaporation fraction (EF, ratio between latent heat flux and available energy) can be used to describe the splitting of available energy into sensible and latent heat fluxes. The LAS instrument can measure the sensible heat flux at a larger scale than the EC system.
research objective: In this work, a dual-pass data assimilation scheme is developed to improve predictions of surface flux.

The current study constructed a dual-pass data assimilation scheme with an ensemble Kalman filter (EnKF) to improve the surface flux predictions with assimilation of remotely sensed land surface temperature. This study carried out the first experiment to assimilate remotely sensed land surface temperatures (LST) derived from FY3A-VIRR into a land surface model.

In this study, a dual-pass data assimilation scheme was constructed to estimate the surface fluxes via the independent optimization of the soil moisture and vegetation parameters. The aim of this study was to eliminate or reduce the errors between the model simulation and observation.
challenges: Methods are difficult to use for continuous monitoring of surface fluxes because the data derived from satellites are instantaneous and often contaminated by the presence of clouds.

However, these measurements are difficult to use for monitoring surface fluxes at the regional scale because they only produce either point or patch-scale data. The deviations between the FY3A-VIRR LST data and the ground measurements are determined by many factors. The terrain effect can affect the accuracy of the FY3A-VIRR LST retrievals. The mismatch of the spatial and temporal scales between the FY3A-VIRR and field-measured LST can also cause these biases.

The differences between the sensible heat fluxes measured by the EC and LAS system are primarily caused by the energy imbalance of the EC, the heterogeneity of the underlying surfaces, and the differences between the source areas of the EC and LAS measurements. Because of the short memory of the land surface temperature, it is difficult to assimilate the land surface temperatures. Directly assimilating land surface temperature to optimize soil moisture may cause model simulations that are more unstable.
methods: In this work, a dual-pass data assimilation scheme is developed to improve predictions of surface flux. Pass 1 of the dual-pass data assimilation scheme optimizes the model vegetation parameters at the weekly temporal scale, and Pass 2 optimizes the soil moisture at the daily temporal scale. Based on ensemble Kalman filter (EnKF), the land surface temperature (LST) data derived from the new generation of Chinese meteorology satellite (FY3A-VIRR) are assimilated into common land model (CoLM) for the first time. Six sites, Daman, Guantao, Arou, BJ, Miyun and Jiyuan, are selected for the data assimilation experiments and include different climatological conditions.

The dual-pass data assimilation technique employed in this study optimizes the model states and parameters independently. The two passes of the scheme assimilate the remotely sensed land surface temperatures (LST) derived from the FY3A satellite. With the assimilation of the FY3A-VIRR LST data, Pass 1 is used to optimize the model parameters at the weekly temporal scale, and Pass 2 is used to optimize the soil moisture at the daily temporal scale. Six Chinese flux observation sites with different land cover types (alpine meadow, grassland, cropland, and orchard) were selected to conduct the data assimilation experiments. The FY3A-VIRR LST data are compared with the ground measurements.

In this study, the MODIS LAI products are incorporated directly into the model, and the vegetation parameters are optimized at the weekly temporal scale with Pass 1 of the dual-pass data assimilation scheme. At the daily temporal scale, the soil moisture is optimized with Pass 2 of the dual-pass data assimilation scheme. The land surface temperature data from the new generation Chinese meteorology satellite FY3A-VIRR were assimilated into CoLM for the first time based on the EnKF algorithm. The source areas of the LAS measurements were calculated using a footprint model and overlaid with a FY3A-VIRR pixel.
dataset: The land surface temperature (LST) data derived from the new generation of Chinese meteorology satellite (FY3A-VIRR) are assimilated into common land model (CoLM) for the first time. Six sites, Daman, Guantao, Arou, BJ, Miyun and Jiyuan, are selected for the data assimilation experiments and include different climatological conditions. The results are compared with those from a dataset generated by a multi-scale surface flux observation system that includes an automatic weather station (AWS), eddy covariance (EC) and large aperture scintillometer (LAS).

The FY-3A land surface temperature data will become the new data source for global water and energy balance research. The FY3A-VIRR LST products can provide the LST and emissivity of each pixel, and the data are stored in a hierarchical data format (HDF), which is a sinusoidal projection with a spatial resolution of 1 km. Data from six sites located in three major nature zones (western arid and semi-arid area, eastern monsoon area, and Qinghai-Tibet alpine meadow) of People’s Republic of China (PRC) are used for the data assimilation experiments.
findings: The results indicate that the dual-pass data assimilation scheme is able to reduce model uncertainties and improve predictions of surface flux with the assimilation of FY3A-VIRR LST data.

The dual-pass data assimilation scheme reduced the model uncertainties and improved the prediction abilities of the model. The average BIAS values of the six sites changed from 28.7 to 5.3 W m 2 and from 16.9 to 16.1 W m2; the average RMSE values dropped from 71.7 to 46.8 W m 2 and from 93.7 to 70.8 W m 2; and the average R-values increased from 0.75 to 0.78 and from 0.66 to 0.82, respectively. The average BIAS values of the assimilation EF results dropped from 0.21 to 0.01, the average RMSE values dropped from 0.31 to 0.15, and the average R-values increased from 0.43 to 0.73. The comparisons showed that the assimilation results match well against the LAS measurements, and the correlations between the assimilation results and LAS measurements were higher than that of the model simulations at the Daman, Guantao, Arou, BJ, and Jiyuan sites.
backgroundCn: 对陆地表面通量的准确监测对于全球气候变化研究、生态环境管理以及农业和水资源规划是必要的。表面通量的大小在很大程度上由植被参数、土壤湿度和其他地表状态决定。估算表面通量的主要方法包括现场测量、基于遥感的方法和陆面模型。现场测量的表面通量在日变化、季节变化和年际变化的时间尺度上存在变异性。
陆面模型的快速发展使其能够在连续的空间和时间尺度上预测表面通量，并具备物理约束。无论具体的模型结构如何，所有陆面模型都需要观测数据来校准其参数和调整其状态。新的技术，如数据同化，亟需将现场或遥感观测与模型进行整合，从而通过修正模型状态变量和参数来提高模型的准确性。数据同化在改善陆面状态变量的预测方面发挥了越来越重要的作用，例如叶面积指数、土壤温度剖面、土壤湿度剖面以及其他相关变量，如表面通量。

空间分布的表面通量估计可以通过基于遥感的方法获得。表面通量也可以通过变分技术和相对简单的模型，结合现场测量的地表温度进行同化来获得。在陆面模型中，显热和潜热通量是诊断变量，受许多因素（例如模型状态和参数）的影响。作为新一代中国极轨气象卫星，FY-3系列包括两颗实验卫星（FY-3A/B）和至少四颗运营卫星（FY-3C/D/E/F）。FY-3系列预计服务寿命将持续到2020年。FY-3A卫星于2008年发射。可见光和红外辐射仪（VIRR）是FY-3A卫星上安装的11个传感器之一，具有约1 km×1 km的名义空间分辨率。共同陆面模型（CoLM）是由多个团队开发的先进模型，并经过广泛的现场数据验证。在CoLM中，土壤湿度对于将净辐射分配到地面热、显热和潜热通量中非常重要。
不准确的表面通量预测与地表温度估计的误差高度相关。一般来说，CoLM能够正确预测地表温度和表面通量的日变化趋势。日均蒸发分数（EF，即潜热通量与可用能量的比率）可以用来描述可用能量在显热通量和潜热通量之间的分配。LAS仪器能够在比EC系统更大规模上测量显热通量。
research objectiveCn: 在这项工作中，开发了一种双重通道数据同化方案，以改善对表面通量的预测。
本研究构建了一种双重数据同化方案，采用集合卡尔曼滤波器（EnKF）来改善表面通量预测，并同化遥感获取的地表温度。该研究首次进行实验，将来自FY3A-VIRR的遥感地表温度（LST）同化到陆面模型中。
在本研究中，构建了一种双重数据同化方案，通过独立优化土壤湿度和植被参数来估计表面通量。该研究的目的是消除或减少模型模拟与观测之间的误差。
challengesCn: 由于卫星获取的数据是瞬时的，并且常常受到云层的干扰，因此使用方法对表面通量进行连续监测是困难的。
然而，这些测量在区域尺度上监测表面通量时很难使用，因为它们只能产生点或斑块尺度的数据。FY3A-VIRR LST 数据与地面测量之间的偏差受到许多因素的影响。地形效应会影响 FY3A-VIRR LST 检索的准确性。FY3A-VIRR 与现场测量的 LST 之间的空间和时间尺度不匹配也可能导致这些偏差。
通过EC和LAS系统测量的显热通量之间的差异主要是由于EC的能量不平衡、底层表面的异质性以及EC和LAS测量的源区之间的差异。由于地表温度的短期记忆，直接同化地表温度以优化土壤湿度可能会导致模型模拟的不稳定性。
methodsCn: 在这项工作中，开发了一种双重数据同化方案，以改善地表通量的预测。双重数据同化方案的第一阶段在周时间尺度上优化模型植被参数，第二阶段在日时间尺度上优化土壤湿度。基于集成卡尔曼滤波器（EnKF），首次将新一代中国气象卫星（FY3A-VIRR）获取的地表温度（LST）数据同化到常见陆面模型（CoLM）中。选择了六个站点，分别是大满、馆陶、阿柔、北京、密云和济源，进行数据同化实验，这些站点具有不同的气候条件。
本研究中采用的双重数据同化技术独立优化模型状态和参数。该方案的两个阶段同化来自FY3A卫星的遥感地表温度（LST）。在同化FY3A-VIRR LST数据的过程中，第一阶段用于在周时间尺度上优化模型参数，第二阶段用于在日时间尺度上优化土壤湿度。选择了六个不同土地覆盖类型（高山草甸、草地、农田和果园）的中国通量观测站进行数据同化实验。FY3A-VIRR LST数据与地面测量结果进行了比较。
在本研究中，MODIS LAI 产品被直接纳入模型中，植被参数在每周时间尺度上通过双重数据同化方案的第一阶段进行优化。在每日时间尺度上，土壤湿度通过双重数据同化方案的第二阶段进行优化。基于EnKF算法，来自新一代中国气象卫星FY3A-VIRR的地表温度数据首次被同化到CoLM中。LAS测量的源区通过足迹模型计算，并与FY3A-VIRR像元叠加。
datasetCn: 来自新一代中国气象卫星（FY3A-VIRR）的地表温度（LST）数据首次被同化到通用陆地模型（CoLM）中。选择了六个站点，分别是大闸、广陶、阿柔、北京、密云和济源，进行数据同化实验，这些站点涵盖了不同的气候条件。结果与由多尺度表面通量观测系统生成的数据集进行比较，该系统包括自动气象站（AWS）、涡度协方差（EC）和大孔径闪烁仪（LAS）。
FY-3A地表温度数据将成为全球水分和能量平衡研究的新数据源。FY3A-VIRR LST产品可以提供每个像素的地表温度和发射率，数据以层次数据格式（HDF）存储，采用正弦投影，空间分辨率为1公里。来自中华人民共和国三个主要自然区域（西部干旱和半干旱地区、东部季风区和青藏高原 alpine meadow）的六个站点的数据用于数据同化实验。
findingsCn: 结果表明，双通道数据同化方案能够通过同化FY3A-VIRR地表温度数据来减少模型不确定性，并改善地表通量的预测。

双重数据同化方案减少了模型的不确定性，提高了模型的预测能力。六个站点的平均偏差（BIAS）值从28.7 W m 2降至5.3 W m 2，从16.9 W m 2升至16.1 W m 2；平均均方根误差（RMSE）值从71.7 W m 2降至46.8 W m 2，从93.7 W m 2降至70.8 W m 2；平均相关系数（R值）从0.75升至0.78，从0.66升至0.82。同化的蒸散发（EF）结果的平均偏差值从0.21降至0.01，平均均方根误差值从0.31降至0.15，平均相关系数值从0.43升至0.73。比较结果表明，同化结果与激光雷达（LAS）测量值匹配良好，并且同化结果与LAS测量值之间的相关性高于模型模拟在大门、馆陶、阿柔、北京和济源站点的相关性。

Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个示例数据集，说明在高山地区使用涡度协方差系统测量表面通量的情况？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a method used to improve the accuracy of hydrological models in alpine regions through data collection?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个通过数据收集来提高高山地区水文模型准确性的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: An integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network has been implemented in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin, which includes automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations. This network aims to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological models and validate remote sensing products, thus improving the prediction of hydrological processes in alpine regions.
Example.AnswerCn: 在黑河流域上游实施了一个集成的、分布式的多尺度观测网络，该网络包括自动气象站和用于雪和冻土观测的超级站。该网络旨在为水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，并验证遥感产品，从而提高对高山地区水文过程的预测。

Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 高海拔地区使用的涡度协方差数据收集方法的关键特征是什么？

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced when collecting hydrological data in alpine regions compared to arid regions, and how do these challenges impact the development of observation networks?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集水文数据与在干旱地区收集水文数据时面临的挑战有什么不同，这些挑战如何影响观测网络的发展？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In alpine regions, challenges include cold climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which hinder complete data collection and the development of models and remote sensing technologies. The scarcity of data due to technological barriers has led to the creation of next-generation observation networks. In contrast, arid regions face issues such as strong advective conditions affecting EC measurements. These challenges influence the design and implementation of observation networks, with alpine networks focusing on integrated, distributed systems to capture snow and frozen ground data, while networks in arid regions may focus on overcoming energy balance closure issues.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，挑战包括寒冷的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了完整数据的收集以及模型和遥感技术的发展。由于技术障碍导致数据稀缺，促使了下一代观测网络的创建。相比之下，干旱地区面临的问题包括强烈的平流条件影响了生态系统（EC）测量。这些挑战影响了观测网络的设计和实施，高山网络侧重于集成的分布式系统，以捕捉雪和冻土数据，而干旱地区的网络可能更注重克服能量平衡闭合问题。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can the development of an integrated, distributed observation network contribute to overcoming the scarcity of observation data in alpine hydrology research?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 开发集成的分布式观测网络可以通过哪些方式帮助克服高山水文研究中观测数据的稀缺性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: An integrated, distributed observation network can overcome the scarcity of observation data in alpine hydrology by providing consistent, multiscale datasets that capture hydrometeorological processes across different spatial and temporal scales. By connecting automatic meteorological stations, snow and frozen ground superstations, and wireless sensor networks, researchers can gather detailed data on key variables like snow depth, soil moisture, and freeze-thaw cycles. This comprehensive data collection supports model development, validation, and the evaluation of remote sensing products, thereby advancing the understanding of hydrological processes in alpine regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 一个集成的分布式观测网络可以通过提供一致的、多尺度的数据集来克服高山水文学中观测数据的稀缺性，这些数据集能够捕捉不同空间和时间尺度上的水文气象过程。通过连接自动气象站、雪和冻土超级站以及无线传感器网络，研究人员可以收集关于雪深、土壤湿度和冻融循环等关键变量的详细数据。这种全面的数据收集支持模型开发、验证和遥感产品的评估，从而推动对高山地区水文过程的理解。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What challenges lead to gaps in data collection for alpine hydrological models, particularly in regions with harsh climates and complex topography?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在气候恶劣和地形复杂的地区，哪些挑战导致高山水文模型的数据收集出现差距？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Several challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection in alpine regions. This scarcity of observation data hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 多个挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了在高山地区进行全面和一致的数据收集。这种观测数据的稀缺妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to achieve accurate surface flux predictions using land surface temperature data from satellites?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 使用卫星的地表温度数据来实现准确的表面通量预测为何困难？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurate surface flux predictions are highly correlated with errors in land surface temperature estimates. The data derived from satellites are instantaneous and often contaminated by clouds, leading to challenges in continuous monitoring of surface fluxes. Additionally, the short memory of land surface temperature makes direct assimilation into models challenging, causing potential instability in simulations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 准确的表面通量预测与地表温度估计的误差高度相关。来自卫星的数据是瞬时的，且常常受到云层的干扰，这导致了对表面通量的连续监测面临挑战。此外，地表温度的短期记忆使得直接同化到模型中变得困难，从而可能导致模拟的不稳定性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes discrepancies in measuring sensible heat flux between eddy covariance and large aperture scintillometer systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致涡度协方差法和大孔径闪烁仪系统在测量显热通量时出现差异的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Discrepancies in measuring sensible heat flux between the eddy covariance (EC) and large aperture scintillometer (LAS) systems are primarily caused by the energy imbalance of the EC, the heterogeneity of the underlying surfaces, and the differences between the source areas of the EC and LAS measurements.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 通过涡度协方差（EC）和大孔径闪烁仪（LAS）系统测量显热通量之间的差异，主要是由于EC的能量不平衡、底层表面的异质性以及EC和LAS测量的源区之间的差异所导致的。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of integrating high-resolution soil physics datasets in understanding freeze-thaw cycles within alpine regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将高分辨率土壤物理数据集整合到理解高山地区的冻融循环中的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating high-resolution soil physics datasets can lead to a more detailed understanding of the freeze-thaw processes within alpine regions. Such datasets can help capture the dynamic hydrothermal processes within the soil, which are crucial for parameterizing alpine hydrologic models. This could ultimately improve the accuracy of predicting hydrological processes and ecosystem functions in these regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合高分辨率土壤物理数据集可以更详细地理解高山地区的冻融过程。这些数据集有助于捕捉土壤内动态的水热过程，这对于参数化高山水文模型至关重要。这最终可以提高对这些地区水文过程和生态系统功能预测的准确性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What consequences might arise from using a dual-pass data assimilation scheme to improve surface flux predictions with remotely sensed land surface temperature data?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用双重数据同化方案来改善与遥感地表温度数据相关的表面通量预测可能会产生哪些后果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using a dual-pass data assimilation scheme with remotely sensed land surface temperature data can significantly reduce model uncertainties and enhance the prediction accuracy of surface fluxes. This approach enables independent optimization of soil moisture and vegetation parameters, leading to better alignment between model simulations and observations, thereby improving the overall reliability of surface flux predictions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用双重数据同化方案结合遥感地表温度数据，可以显著减少模型不确定性并提高地表通量预测的准确性。这种方法能够独立优化土壤湿度和植被参数，从而使模型模拟与观测之间的对齐更好，从而提高地表通量预测的整体可靠性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to develop a distributed and multiscale observation network for hydrometeorological data in alpine regions such as the Heihe River Basin (HRB)?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在像黑河流域（HRB）这样的高山地区开发分布式和多尺度的水文气象观测网络很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The development of such a network aims to provide accurate hydrometeorological data, especially concerning snow and frozen ground processes, to improve the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. This is crucial due to the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions and the need to address the impacts of climate change and human activities on hydrological processes and eco-functions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 该网络的开发旨在提供准确的水文气象数据，特别是关于雪和冻土过程的数据，以改善对高山水文过程和生态功能的预测理解。这对于解决高山地区观测数据稀缺的问题以及应对气候变化和人类活动对水文过程和生态功能的影响至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the goal of implementing a dual-pass data assimilation scheme using remotely sensed land surface temperature data in land surface models?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在陆面模型中使用遥感地表温度数据实施双通道数据同化方案的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to improve the accuracy of surface flux predictions by reducing model uncertainties through the independent optimization of soil moisture and vegetation parameters. Assimilating land surface temperature data from satellites like FY3A-VIRR into land surface models enhances the model's ability to predict surface fluxes accurately, thus supporting global climate change research and resource management.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是通过独立优化土壤湿度和植被参数来减少模型不确定性，从而提高表面通量预测的准确性。将来自FY3A-VIRR等卫星的地表温度数据同化到陆面模型中，增强了模型准确预测表面通量的能力，从而支持全球气候变化研究和资源管理。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the steps involved in using eddy covariance systems to measure surface fluxes accurately, and how is data quality ensured during this process?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 使用涡度相关系统准确测量地表通量涉及哪些步骤，以及在此过程中如何确保数据质量？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The eddy covariance system involves several steps for measuring surface fluxes, including data collection at a 10 Hz sampling frequency, data processing using software like Eddypro to produce 30-minute flux averages, and applying corrections such as coordinate rotation and density corrections. Quality assurance is ensured through steps like removing data with high missing rates, instrument errors, and periods around precipitation events, alongside evaluating atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 涡动协方差系统涉及多个步骤来测量表面通量，包括以10 Hz的采样频率进行数据收集，使用像Eddypro这样的软件进行数据处理以生成30分钟的通量平均值，以及应用坐标旋转和密度修正等校正。质量保证通过以下步骤确保：去除缺失率高的数据、仪器错误数据以及降水事件前后的数据，同时评估大气稳定性和湍流相似性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the accurate monitoring of hydrometeorological processes and snow cover in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在高山地区准确监测水文气象过程和雪盖成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and superstations equipped with state-of-the-art instruments has enabled accurate monitoring. Techniques include high-resolution soil physics datasets, Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera for thermal radiation measurements, and GMON for snow water equivalent (SWE) measurements.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 自动气象站（AMSs）和配备先进仪器的超级气象站的使用，使得监测变得更加准确。技术包括高分辨率土壤物理数据集、用于热辐射测量的Fluke Ti55热红外相机，以及用于雪水当量（SWE）测量的GMON。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do integrated observation networks facilitate the collection of multiscale hydrometeorological data in challenging alpine environments?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 综合观测网络如何在挑战性的高山环境中促进多尺度水文气象数据的收集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Integrated observation networks, which connect multiple AMSs and superstations, facilitate the collection of multiscale data. These networks are designed to capture meteorological variables, snow cover, and frozen ground processes, thereby addressing the challenges posed by harsh climates, high altitudes, and complex topographies.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 综合观测网络连接多个自动气象站（AMS）和超级站，促进多尺度数据的收集。这些网络旨在捕捉气象变量、雪盖和冻土过程，从而应对恶劣气候、高海拔和复杂地形带来的挑战。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or methodologies enable the effective assimilation of satellite-derived land surface temperature data to improve surface flux predictions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件或方法能够有效地吸收卫星获取的地表温度数据，以改善地表通量预测？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The effective assimilation of satellite-derived land surface temperature data is enabled by using a dual-pass data assimilation scheme with an ensemble Kalman filter (EnKF). This approach optimizes model vegetation parameters and soil moisture independently, allowing for improved surface flux predictions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 通过使用双重数据同化方案与集合卡尔曼滤波器（EnKF），有效地同化卫星获取的地表温度数据。该方法独立优化模型的植被参数和土壤湿度，从而提高地表通量预测的准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection in alpine regions face significant challenges despite advances in technology?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 尽管技术取得了进步，为什么在高山地区的数据收集可能面临重大挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 多个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了在需要时进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What could be the reasons for the high uncertainty in surface flux predictions even with sophisticated land surface models?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 即使使用先进的陆面模型，表面通量预测的不确定性仍然很高的原因可能是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inaccurate surface flux predictions are highly correlated with errors in land surface temperature estimates. The terrain effect, the mismatch of the spatial and temporal scales between satellite data and field measurements, and the energy imbalance of measurement systems are factors contributing to high uncertainty.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 不准确的表面通量预测与地表温度估计的误差高度相关。地形效应、卫星数据与现场测量之间的空间和时间尺度不匹配，以及测量系统的能量失衡是导致高不确定性的因素。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might integrating remote sensing data with field observations be essential for hydrological modeling in alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 将遥感数据与实地观测相结合，对于阿尔卑斯地区的水文模型至关重要的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The integration of remote sensing data with field observations is essential because remote sensing can improve the prediction of hydrological processes, compensate for the scarcity of observation data in difficult-to-access alpine regions, and provide necessary validation and calibration due to the complexities of the earth system.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 遥感数据与实地观测的结合至关重要，因为遥感可以提高水文过程的预测能力，弥补难以到达的高山地区观测数据的稀缺，并提供必要的验证和校准，以应对地球系统的复杂性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the effectiveness of using eddy covariance systems for measuring evapotranspiration and surface fluxes in complex terrain environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您对在复杂地形环境中使用涡度协方差系统测量蒸散发和表面通量的有效性有何评估？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance systems are widely used for measuring evapotranspiration and surface fluxes due to their ability to provide direct and continuous measurements. However, their effectiveness in complex terrain environments can be challenging due to issues such as incomplete energy balance closure and the influence of heterogeneous landscapes. These challenges necessitate careful site selection, data processing, and potential integration with remote sensing or modeling approaches to improve accuracy.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统因其能够提供直接和连续的测量而广泛用于测量蒸散发和表面通量。然而，在复杂地形环境中，它们的有效性可能会面临挑战，例如能量平衡闭合不完全和异质景观的影响。这些挑战需要仔细的站点选择、数据处理，以及可能与遥感或建模方法的结合，以提高准确性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you assess the challenges faced in collecting high-quality snow and frozen ground data in alpine regions, and what strategies might improve these data collection efforts?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在高山地区收集高质量雪和冻土数据所面临的挑战，以及有哪些策略可以改善这些数据收集工作？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Collecting high-quality snow and frozen ground data in alpine regions faces significant challenges due to harsh climates, high altitudes, and complex topography, which limit consistent data collection. To improve data collection efforts, strategies could include deploying advanced sensor networks, integrating remote sensing technologies, and establishing distributed observation networks with automatic meteorological stations and superstations to capture detailed snow and soil data over time.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在高山地区收集高质量的雪和冻土数据面临着重大挑战，原因在于恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这限制了一致的数据收集。为了改善数据收集工作，可以采取的策略包括部署先进的传感器网络、整合遥感技术，以及建立分布式观测网络，配备自动气象站和超级气象站，以便随着时间的推移捕捉详细的雪和土壤数据。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: From your perspective, how well do current satellite-derived land surface temperature (LST) data integrate with land surface models to enhance surface flux predictions, and what improvements could be made?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 从您的角度来看，当前卫星获取的地表温度（LST）数据与地表模型的集成程度如何，以增强地表通量预测？可以做哪些改进？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Satellite-derived land surface temperature (LST) data can significantly enhance surface flux predictions when integrated with land surface models, such as through data assimilation techniques like the dual-pass scheme with ensemble Kalman filter. However, improvements could be made by addressing issues like spatial and temporal mismatches, cloud contamination, and terrain effects, potentially through the development of more sophisticated retrieval algorithms and better ground validation efforts.

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the data collection methods used for capturing snow accumulation and ablation processes in alpine hydrology observation networks.

Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Snow accumulation and ablation processes are captured using a snow observation superstation with advanced techniques and instruments. These data help in understanding snow cover properties and their effects on hydrological processes.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 雪积累和融化过程通过使用先进技术和仪器的雪观测超级站进行捕捉。雪深通过SR50A超声波传感器进行测量，雪水当量通过GammaMONitor (GMON)进行测量。不同高度的吹雪通量通过FlowCapt进行测量。这些数据有助于理解雪盖特性及其对水文过程的影响。
